replies.body: If even the pro players are saying the meta is trash, which many of them have, then Riot seriously needs to work on it.

{{champion:8}} not really noticeable early game unless he hits you with an empowered q.
{{champion:91}}  they've had in tooltips since god knows how long he is the leader of lvl2 first bloods.
{{champion:133}} yeah she's starting to get very annoying appearing everywhere, and not even after lvl6.
{{champion:238}},  and {{item:3147}} is a pain you could be linked to a 350 armor {{champion:44}}  with max w, {{item:3109}}, and still go poof.
{{champion:23}} is going ap which is very concerning  from the last couple of times on hit ad champs went ap (talking about you {{champion:11}} ).
and tbh i haven't seen a {{champion:63}} in a while so idk about him.

>{{champion:23}}  is going ap which is very concerning from the last couple of times on hit ad champs went ap

Don't people want alternate builds to be viable? Or is this one of those cases where "Oh other builds are fine except this one this is a bad off-meta build that should be removed"?

Oh please, alternate builds on Trynd were black cleaver/titanic bruiser builds as opposed to standard glass cannon crit. for something to be an alternate build would mean that prior to changes people utilized it. it was only after they changed crit and buffed his E that he built ap. honestly ap trynd is much more potent than straight ad/crit trynd because he's doing magic damage on hit with rageblade/lichbane, healing at vlad rate, AND doing true damage with conqueror.
Ah, ok, so basically it doesn't count so long as it's an alternate build path/off-meta set-up we hate. Gotcha.
if people didn't find it oppressive they wouldn't have changed it back in season 2
alternate builds are fine, but it's when a build has overshadowed the others that is bad
Why? Ezreal was created as a mage and primarily was played ap caster before he got tons of nerfs and resorted to an alternate ad build. Which is now standard btw.

{{champion:35}} has had his E reworked into physical damage so that he can't build AP and be viable
{{champion:28}} has been reworked into an AP-exclusive champion (and I used to play her either full AD or hybrid, never full AP)

The issue with AP {{champion:23}} is that magic damage against towers are busted, and he can still right-click things BY DEALING MAGIC DAMAGE. Have you *ever* seen a mage dealing physical damage with its spells with  an alternate build ?
Ya. Ap MF did physical damage with her ult for a while when it could still be played.
Considering that MF is basically just "press R, and then be useless until ult comes off cooldown" that only goes so far.

Related point I was playing Jinx and an Ahri popped on me.  Now she was 8/2.  She was a big gal I'm not denying that.

But I broke her gawdamn ankles.  Juked the charm and the Q.  Her foxfire procced ludens electrocute and still took 90% of my hp.

I had a +25 mr that was turning into a hex.  I still had to blow both summs.

Being ahead or even super fed never meant you could play like garbage and still get kills.  

I'm dead convinced if you can take electrocute and build protobelt and take ignite you can play like a baboon and still get kills.

I was really fed not gonna lie like 14/1 on Veigar, and got a one shot on enemy panth, just because of all the free dmg i get from predator and ludens, WHICH THEN increases the dmg from my ult. I didnt feel good, i felt like i dont deserve it. He also had mercs and 2500 hp. Before this season it was impossible to kill anyone with just R unless insanely insanely far ahead and if the guy had no magic resistance and no extra hp. Now its a total joke.

It's simple. 
GAMEPLAY doesn't equal MONEY

so why would they care.

LCS AND SKINS equal MONEY... and it sucks to think my favorite game is dying due to greed.

Dunno why people are so blind for this. 
This is just how tencent works.
Look at pubg, look at their mobile gmes, look at league. 
It's all about milking off as much as possible and then leave the games to rot.

The problem is that Riot wants to make nerfs/buffs that would be helpful in the long term? You can't just trash a champion, otherwise the pick rate would drop and the champion would be considered not viable in the meta(and other stuff etc.). Since in the first place, they did those buffs to pick up higher pick rate in those champs.(like that random Kindred buff)

Another annoying thing is how these champs(most of them) had low pick rates around the times they were buffed, and the mains of those champs look at buffs, thinking those are going to make this champ broken, so might as use it to get some free wins. 

Cause the mains do say something about it, nothing much will change but for the pick rate to accelerate quicker and ban rate will go up once people who just pick it up starts to abuse it. And it is annoying to not be able to play your favorite champion cause it is permabanned.

Riot need to find a new way to try to bring low pick rates up besides buffing.

{{champion:8}} has been a balance issue even before his rework, biggest issue is actually his crazy point and click sustain (that has been reworked to be even more broken because now it can heal for half of his hp if he's below 50%)

Same as {{champion:13}} they simply don't want to acknowledge that his 2 sec root point and click on W is the issue, and instead keep reworking him without touching the spell
{{champion:7}} blowing people up with just {{item:1056}} {{item:1052}}

The actual title of this thread should be "We've been circlejerking for months why isn't riot listening to our bullshit"? We agreed with ourselves and told everyone who said otherwise to fuck off like that's a real argument why isn't riot doing what we say.

And your comment is the type of ignorance that is just the same as those you are complaining about.

You completely ignored the good posts people made that do use evidence, justify themselves, and are actually correct.

But anyway, doesn't what you said also apply to the post(the one he is responding to) too? It is just everybody don't have good word choice and they can't see the tone of what they are saying. Sometimes I think my reply might have been ignorant(even tho it isn't) cause people's replies sound so ignorant .


The only problem is that there ends up having ignorant people on both sides(people supporting the original poster and against). And there might be that one good counter post(and sometimes long) against the good original post that will doesn't get addressed or noticed. Which feels bad. cause the counter poster might forgot about it. or forced to move on from their effort and waste of time

Plus if the good post is correct(through evidence, justification), there isn't much to say unless you have something to counter it(even tho your counter argument isn't a proper one and comes off ignorant, but you think it is worth saying for some reason)  This wasn't aimed at you, but other people in general.
Such an incorrect post from the Title. They are not pretending hard at all.
Then you look at the Fizz and Lee buffs on PBE and you realize that Riot is actually making MORE of these problems, not fixing them.

Talon, Brand, Vlad, and Graves are the big 4 imo

All 4 are completely overtuned and ridiculous. Vlad, Brand, and Talon also have the issue of having completely cancerous kits with little counterplay, and extremely low skill floor/ceilings.

Eh, I don't think of Graves as an issue. I face him constantly with champions like Pantheon and Trundle and never have an issue with him. Unless he pops off and gets a lot of kills early (4-5), he's easily beaten. Kindred is a whole different story, she has dash with a shorter cool down, has a slow with a larger radius that does more damage, has longer range on her autos, and does more damage overall. Never mind her ultimate that allows her to duel anyone no matter how far behind she is.
Wait you don't have a problem facing him with equally overpowered champions? Wow wht a total not coincidence.
